title: Why are players so mean?
body:
So I find that people on league get angry over the tiniest of things, and I'm not saying stuff I do i'm even talking about just how i notice others act towards team members. I find they can be extremely moody and cry babies :P which makes it off putting to play this game. Idk i just find that attitude and speech is just so vulgar and immature. Like all the games i've been playing tonight there's always one jerk in the game lol. And i try and be nice and tell people their doing a good job and to be honest couldn't care less if people still my kills. 

Opinions?

replies.body:
It's not PLAYERS, it's PEOPLE.

People in an anonymous environment.

There have been many psychological studies over the years that prove that people act according to their true nature in an anonymous environment such as the internet.
If you talk to a person face to face they will act based on how they want to be perceived.
If you talk to the same person online they don't care about how others see them, and thus they don't try to hide anything because it can't effect them as it would if they acted like a prick to you face to face.

This is especially true for children online.
They want to know they have an impact, and they will poke and poke as hard as they can to get a reaction in order to feel accomplished.
Upon getting a reaction they realise they have an in and tear at the opening as hard as they can.

It's not the game.
At all.
It's the environment.
It is 100% because they know you don't know who they are, nor can you influence anything in their life.

Again. IT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE GAME.

You'll drop me? lol, ok. good luck with that.  You're the type of person i'm probably talking about. 

also, :) :) :) :) :)
People value winning far to much that its spread into aram and norms, as opposed to just having fun and enjoying ones self regardless of your score or win/lose status

That's the million dollar question really. I strongly recommend checking out the first 6 minutes or so of Lyte's GDC presentation for his near perfect summary of why internet culture has evolved in such a (negative) way.

http://www.gdcvault.com/play/1022160/More-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player

Because its a stressful game. Everyone wants to win and rank up. Toxicity is a problem in any multiplayer game really, especially a team based one where its very hard to solo carry. Because of the fact that, after the game, you'll likely never see anybody you played with every again, people don't really care about what they say to others. People also don't like to accept their own mistakes. They always find a reason to blame someone other than themselves so they don't have to accept the fact that they screwed up.

I don't see it as a stressful game, like I'm talking about unranked mode not ranked. And I agree it is something found in other multiplayer games as well. And I think they should care about what they say to others. I find league, out of other multiplayer games, one where people really do blame others when they are at fault :P
